Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli

Class CLI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli.CLI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI
public class CLI
extends java.lang.Object
implements UI
Command Line Interface for the Client.

    InputStream for inputs from the server.
    private boolean lost
    Set to true when user has lost in a 3-player game.

    Internal queue for direct inputs from the user.

    OutputStream for outputs to the server.

    Set to true on start and false on stop.

    Socket for server communications.

    Queue for all incoming messages from the server.

    Allows displaying the current state of the Game Board on the CLI, using the following notation: " " if the cell is empty; "X" if the cell has a Dome; "1" if the cell is at building level 1; "2" if the cell is at building level 2; "3" if the cell is at building level 3; "r" if the cell is occupied by a red Worker; "g" if the cell is occupied by a green Worker; "b" if the cell is occupied by a blue Worker;

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Allows CLI to run until the Game is over. Handles the connection of the client to the server and opens a communication channel between them. If an IOException or a ClassCastException occur while opening that channel, the CLI stops. Creates a messageQueue where the input provided by the client will be offered, and a serverQueue where the messages from the server will be put after deserialization. Starts two threads which respectively allows listening to the client input and listening to the server messages. Every time a message from the server is put on the serverQueue, it is parsed to the corresponding action.
      Specified by:
      run in interface UI

    • inputListener

      private void inputListener()
      Permanently listens to the client, taking its input from the command line and offering it on the messageQueue so that it can be processed and sent to the server.

    • serverListener

      public void serverListener()
      Continuously listens to the server. When deserializing a message, puts it on the serverQueue so that it can be processed. If the deserialized message is a Ping from the server, replies with a Pong.
      Specified by:
      serverListener in interface UI

    • quit

      private void quit()
      Calls the stop method.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      If the Game is over, closes the communication channel with the server.
      Specified by:
      stop in interface UI

    • clear

      private void clear()
      Clears the console by printing empty lines.

    • getServerIp

      public java.lang.String getServerIp()
      Allows receiving from the client the IP of the server he wants to connect to. Prints to the command line the request and then calls getString so that the input written by the client can be read and returned.
      Specified by:
      getServerIp in interface UI
      Returns:
      the String written by the client

    • parseMessage

      public void parseMessage​(ToClientMessage message)
      Allows parsing a message received from the server to the corresponding action to do on the client.
      Specified by:
      parseMessage in interface UI
      Parameters:
      message - the ToClientMessage to parse

    • getInt

      private int getInt()
      Takes a message previously put on the messageQueue. If no exception occurs in the parsing of the message to an Integer, that Integer is returned. If a NumberFormatException occurs during parsing, the client is notified he wrote an invalid input. If an InterruptedException occurs during serialization, the client is notified there was an error getting his input.
      Returns:
      the Integer taken from the messageQueue

    • getString

      private java.lang.String getString()
      Takes a message previously put on the messageQueue. If no exception occurs in taking the message, it is returned. If an InterruptedException occurs during serialization, the client is notified there was an error getting his input.
      Returns:
      the String taken from the messageQueue

    • pong

      public void pong()
      Creates a new message (Pong Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.

    • sendBoolean

      public void sendBoolean​(boolean body)
      Creates a new message (SendBoolean Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendBoolean in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the boolean to send to the server in the SendBoolean Message

    • sendInteger

      public void sendInteger​(int body)
      Creates a new message (SendInteger Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendInteger in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the int to send to the server in the SendInteger Message

    • sendIntegers

      public void sendIntegers​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> body)
      Creates a new message (SendIntegers Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendIntegers in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the ArrayList of Integers to send to the server in the SendIntegers Message

    • sendString

      public void sendString​(java.lang.String body)
      Creates a new message (SendString Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendString in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the String to send to the server in the SendString Message

    • chooseCards

      public void chooseCards​(java.util.ArrayList<CardView> possibleCards, int num, java.util.ArrayList<CardView> pickedCards)
      Allows the Player to choose some Cards between those available. He could be asked to choose the 2 or 3 Cards to be used in a 2 or 3-players Game, or his own Card for the Game. The question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseCards in interface UI
      Parameters:
      possibleCards - an ArrayList containing all the available Cards
      num - the number of Cards to choose
      pickedCards - an ArrayList containing all the already picked Cards

    • chooseGameName

      public void chooseGameName​(boolean taken)
      Allows the Player to choose a Game name (max 12 characters and not duplicated). The question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseGameName in interface UI
      Parameters:
      taken - if the previously chosen Game name is already taken, false otherwise

    • chooseGameRoom

      public void chooseGameRoom​(java.util.ArrayList<GameView> gameRooms)
      Allows the Player to choose a Game room. The available Game rooms are displayed on screen; the Player can go back to start a new Game, refresh the list or choose a Game room. The input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseGameRoom in interface UI
      Parameters:
      gameRooms - an ArrayList of GameViews containing all the Game Rooms

    • chooseNickname

      public void chooseNickname​(boolean taken)
      Allows the Player to choose a nickname (max 12 characters and not duplicated). The question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseNickname in interface UI
      Parameters:
      taken - true if the previously chosen nickname is already taken, false otherwise

    • choosePlayersNumber

      public void choosePlayersNumber()
      Allows the Player to choose the number of Players (2 or 3) for the Game he is creating. The question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      choosePlayersNumber in interface UI

    • choosePosition

      public void choosePosition​(java.util.ArrayList<CellView> positions, java.lang.String desc)
      Allows the Player to choose a position between those available. The question and the reason of the choice are displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      choosePosition in interface UI
      Parameters:
      positions - an ArrayList containing CellViews representing all the available positions
      desc - the reason of the choice

    • chooseStartingPlayer

      public void chooseStartingPlayer​(java.util.ArrayList<PlayerView> players)

      Specified by:
      chooseStartingPlayer in interface UI
      Parameters:
      players - an ArrayList of PlayerViews representing all the Players involved in the Game

    • chooseStartJoin

      public void chooseStartJoin()
      Allows the Player to choose between starting a new Game or joining an existing one. The question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseStartJoin in interface UI

    • chooseYesNo

      public void chooseYesNo​(java.lang.String query)

      Specified by:
      chooseYesNo in interface UI
      Parameters:
      query - the "yes or no question" asked to the Player

    • displayBuild

      public void displayBuild​(CellView buildPosition, CardView godCard)
      Allows displaying the build occurred during a turn, by showing the updated Game Board.
      Specified by:
      displayBuild in interface UI
      Parameters:
      buildPosition - the CellView representing the position of the building
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this build

    • displayMove

      public void displayMove​(java.util.HashMap<CellView,​CellView> moves, CardView godCard)
      Allows displaying the move occurred during a turn, by showing the updated Game Board.
      Specified by:
      displayMove in interface UI
      Parameters:
      moves - an HashMap containing pairs of (starting position, final position) for each worker who moved or was forced to move
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this move

      Allows notifying the client that the server is down.

    • displayBoard

      private void displayBoard()
      Allows displaying the current state of the Game Board on the CLI, using the following notation:
      • " " if the cell is empty;
      • "X" if the cell has a Dome;
      • "1" if the cell is at building level 1;
      • "2" if the cell is at building level 2;
      • "3" if the cell is at building level 3;
      • "r" if the cell is occupied by a red Worker;
      • "g" if the cell is occupied by a green Worker;
      • "b" if the cell is occupied by a blue Worker;
